item.description:
Hi Everyone,

I have decided since this is a far away event from the Hartford area its only going to be a Saturday Event and it needs good BEACH WEATHER to make the trip worthwhile.

Well its not blazing hot beach weather, and there is some wind, yet it should be OK for us anyway.

See you all interested  there..

-- EVERYTHING DEPENDS ON PREDICTED WEATHER AND SEA CONDITIONS TO DETERMINE IF THIS LOCATION IS ACCEPTABLE --OR-- IF A MORE APPROPRIATE ALTERNATE LOCATION IS TO BE CHOSEN FOR THE DAY. (Something more local to the Hartford Area). Check Back in a few days for updates and use the links below to see the trend.

IF Necessary -- Saturday Morning apx 8 am based on the current report at the site of the event i will make a decision if it looks like it will not be good enough for the day....

Napatree Point Beach is the main destination to relax for the day's trip.!

Water Conditions :  http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.32113839523956&lon=-71.88560485839844&site=okx&unit=0&lg=en&FcstType=text

Air:   http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KWST&state=RI

 

Tide: http://www.tides.info/?command=view&location=Little%20Narragansett%20Bay%20entrance,%20Rhode%20Island%20Current

Saturday 08/25/12 10:38AM 0 knots

Slack, Flood Begins

 

Saturday 08/25/12 1:40PM 1.35 knots Max Flood


Saturday 08/25/12 4:31PM -0 knots Slack, Ebb Begins

-----------------------------------------

Napatree Point  Beach for us is on the far end of this penninusla:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The trip starts out from Barn Island CT:

http://www.lisrc.uconn.edu/coastalaccess/site.asp?siteid=550

We head out to a Sand Island for a rest, from there we head to  Napatree Point beach and the Old Fort via the Back End.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fort_Mansfield

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------

Nav Chart: (Remember the NAV chart so you won't get lost if you decide to leave early or arrive late).

http://photos2.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/1/8/b/b/highres_50946331.jpeg

----------------------

Barn Island Wildlife Management Area (This is the location of the Pot Luck BBQ up a ways from the parking lot also).

Town: Stonington CT, apx 1 hr 15 minutes from Hartford
GPS apx 300 Palmer Ncek Rd


Directions to the Barn Island Boat Ramp:

http://www.bing.com/maps/explore/#5003/0.5040=rtp:pos.41.722469329834_-72.67726957798_CT-314+%2f+Jordan+Ln~v.41.499335705262_-72.2839659841341_Witch+Meadow+Rd~pos.41.3375616117245_-71.87584282485_300+Palmer+Neck+Rd,+Pawcatuck,+CT+06379:mode:D:rtop:0:avoid:0/5872/style=auto&lat=41.353771&lon=-72.164373&alt=-11.580539&z=11&pid=5874

THE WAY I WILL TAKE IS RT 2 EAST TO rte 11 SOUTH..

TAKE LEFT at Witch Meadow Rd exit to avoid the end of the highway back up,

go to  a right (south) onto rte 85, ---> go under rte 395 ... pass by THE MALL, AND GET ONTO 95 NORTH .

Take I-95 North to exit 91.

Stay straight onto Pequot Trail/Route 234.

Turn right onto Farmholme Road, follow for 1.8 miles.

Turn right onto Stonington Westerly Road.

(Its kind of a Jog)

Take left onto Green Haven Road.

Take an immediate right onto Palmer Neck Road to end.

; road ends at Barn Island Boat Ramp,

Drop off Yaks and park where you can fit.

 

--------------------

Kayaks available:

The following Kayaks with paddles and life jackets are available for the put in site if reserved in advance:

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event, these are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please get a GPS, or a GPS with traffic data is even better.

 

 

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00.

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

RESERVED FOR al-R

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 160 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.    http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706

RESERVED FOR MARIA OR BETSY

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 140 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

RESERVED FOR MARY BETH

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (90 - 135 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cockpit so make sure you can fit in it.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

RESERVED FOR MARIA OR BETSY



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 125 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

RESERVED FOR KAREN

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (150-180 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

BOAT STAYS HOME

SPACE HAS BEEN RESERVED FOR LISA J BOAT

 

See Those that are Interested  at the boat ramp or on the water.. al-r
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing my ORANGE Hunting HAT in the boat ramp area till unloaded and ready to go .

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: AUG 25 KAYAK from BARN ISLAND to NAPATREE BEACH via SANDY POINT + Pot luck BBQ
